title: WE PLOUGH THE FIELDS
author: Matthias Claudius (1782), translated by John C. Messenger

sections.title: Verse 1
content: We plough the fields and scatter
The good seed on the land;
But it is fed and watered
By God's almighty hand.
He sends the sun and rain,
He brings forth bread and grain;
The earth is His, and all that grows
Is from His bounteous grace.

sections.title: Verse 2
content: He only is the Maker
Of all things near and far;
He paints the flowers, He feeds the flocks,
He sends the rolling stars.
He guards our way, He grants
The harvest of the land;
All good gifts around us
Are sent by His command.

sections.title: Chorus
content: All good gifts around us,
All graces we receive,
From His great storehouse in the skies,
We through His mercy live.
He gives all life and breath,
He crowns our days with peace;
O thank Him for His goodness,
O praise His name, give thanks!
